intro: Tithonia argophylla, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark purple central disk florets, which give it a striking appearance. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, also known as the sunflower family, and is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Tithonia argophylla is often used in ornamental gardening and as a forage plant for livestock. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive, somewhat aromatic scent.
